tracks.text: A woman navigates an iPhone app. She presses a Play button.
The woman starts walking down a damp, urban sidewalk. She wears a wide-rimmed hat, a white shirt, and a blue tie.
White text appears. The Man.
Children run behind a sleak car.
A woman with an afro and a white dress rests against the car.
A woman with gold earrings walks down a sidewalk. She passes singer Aloe Blacc, wearing a yellow shirt and tie, and a black leather coat with the collar upright.
Men run down the sidewalk behind Aloe.
A police car pulls up. More people run in different directions.
Firemen spray hoses at protestors. A sign reads "Get the hell out of Vietnam"
Protestors push against police riot shields.
A young black man in a tan suit plays the trumpet.
In a club, Aloe wears a red and black suit. He stands in a spotlight, with gold curtains behind him.
Patrons sit at bars and tables, watching him. The trumpeter intensifies.
In a well lit room, a server places a large bottle of cognac on a baby grand piano.
Aloe sings while at the piano. He wears a red T shirt and white cap.
A cognac colored ash tray glitters in the sun. Well dressed patrons watch the pianist sing while nodding along.
Aloe walks towards us down an apartment building hallway. He wears a brimmed hat, a long sleeve turtle neck, and trousers. He sings to us, while gesturing with outstretched arms.
3 white men emerge from a room in front of Aloe, looking towards us. One man wears boxing gloves and punches the air. The boxer and his escort walk towards us, then go into another room.
The men walk into another room. Aloe continues down the hall, and paparazzi emerge from different rooms.
A woman in an afro and a strapless orange bodysuit dances. Aloe walks into a room, obscured by the dancer.
A red curtain closes on the hallway. The dancer kicks through the curtains, and dances into the room.
We pull out to see a crowd of people holding beer bottles and dancing in a club.
Outside, a photographer stands behind Aloe, who wears a pale suit and Malcolm X's glasses. A bald man in a suit escorts Aloe down the steps. He's surrounded by journalist holding pens and pads.
In a station, Aloe walks into a foyer lined with white police officers. Aloe has short cropped hair, a navy suit, and a thin tie.
On an urban street at dusk, Aloe walks towards us.
4 other suited black men approach him, and they all interlace elbows. They march as a line.
They join a crowd. A sign reads, "We March With Selma". Another reads "Freedom begins at home."
Protestors gather. One holds a fist in the air. We pull out to see a large group of protestors. Fade to black.
